juzs.text: And after that, We did not send down any army from the sky against his people (of the Town), nor do We ever send
Nothing but a single Blast (of Requital), and behold! They were ashes, still and silent
Ah, the anguish for the servants, they have to bear! Never has a Messenger come to them, but they did mock him
Have they not reflected how many a generation We (Our Law of Requital) annihilated before them. They turned not to their Messengers and, hence, returned not to their lost glory
All of them, all together, will be presented before Us

And yet, there is a Sign for them in the lifeless earth which We revive and We bring forth from it grain so that they eat thereof. (Divine Revelation can, likewise, revive dead nations and make them fruitful for humanity)
And We produce therein gardens of date palm and grapevines, and We cause springs to gush forth therein
That they may enjoy the fruit thereof - And! Their hands made this not. Will they not then be grateful in word and action
Glory to Him Who has created pairs of everything that the earth grows, and of themselves, and of things they have no knowledge yet
And a Sign for them is the night. We withdraw from it the day, and behold, they are in darkness

And the sun: it runs its appointed course. That is the measure of the Almighty, the Knower. (The sun along with its system is moving to the Solar Apex, Constellation of Hercules, at a speed 150 miles per second, according to the current science)
And the moon: We have measured for it phases until it becomes (a crescent) like an old curved date-stalk

It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor can the night outrun the day. All of them swim along in their orbits. (The sun cannot cause the moon to gravitate towards itself and the night and the day cannot lengthen or shorten other than the appointed measure (21:33), (22:61), (25:62), (31:29), (4)
Another Sign for them is that We carry the Children of Adam on the loaded ship
And We have created for them similar things to ride on. (And will create things of which you have no knowledge yet)
We could down them, drown them according to Our Laws, with none to respond to their cry of help - and then they cannot be saved
But as a Mercy from Us, We let them enjoy life for a while
And yet, when it is said to them, "Walk aright learning from every yesterday, so that you may build a future worthy of Grace
No Message of their Lord's Messages reaches them without them turning away from it

And when it is said to them, "Spend on others of the provision Allah has given to you", the rejecters say to the believers, "Shall we feed anyone whom Allah could have fed if He so willed? You people are obviously lost in error." (6:149), (1)
And they (change the subject asking), "When will this warning be fulfilled, if you are men of truth?" (That our system of life, if it is wrong, will crumble)
Well, nothing awaits them but a single Blast of Requital that will overtake them while they keep contending
And they shall not even have time to utter their last wish, nor will they be able to get together with their families
And when the Trumpet is blown, behold, out of their disintegrated states unto their Lord they will run. ('Qabr' = grave = disintegrated state)

They will exclaim, "Oh, woe unto us! Who has awakened us from our beds of sleep? This is what the Beneficent promised, and the Messengers spoke the truth." (The concept of punishment in the grave is non-Qur'anic and, hence, wrong)
Nothing but a single Blast, no more, and behold, before Us all of them will be presented
This Day no person will face the least injustice, nor will you be rewarded other than what you had been doing
Behold, those who merit Paradise, this Day are enjoying the new life
They and their spouses in pleasant shades, on thrones of honor reclining
Theirs the fruits of their good deeds, and theirs all that they will ask
Greetings from a Lord Merciful, "Peace
But stand aside Today, you violators of human rights who thrived on others' toil
Did I not warn you O Children of Adam! That you shall not worship Satan, your desire - since verily, it is an open enemy to you
And that you serve Me alone? This is the Straight Path
Yet he led astray a great many of you. Did you not, then, have any sense
This is the Hell you were warned about again and again
Burn in it now for you adamantly rejected the Truth
This Day We seal their mouths, but their hands speak unto Us, and their feet bear witness to what they earned
Had We so Willed, We could have made them devoid of Vision that would make them unaccountable for whichever way they went. (Without free will like the Animal Kingdom)
And had We so Willed, We could have degraded them driven by instincts, powerless to advance or retreat in their potentials
Such as, he whom We grant long life, We cause him to revert to weakness. Will they not then use their intellect? (That they must use their full potentials)

(Know about the Prophet that) We have not taught him poetry, nor is it meet for his dignity. This is no less than a Divine Reminder and an Articulate Qur'an clear in itself and clearly showing the Way
That it may warn everyone who is alive of heart and that the Word may prove True concerning the rejecters. (That violation of the Divine Laws brings Requital in both lives)
Have they never envisioned how We must have created for them of Our Handiwork, the domestic animals of which they are now masters
And that We have made them submissive to humans so that some of them they use for riding and others they consume
And may derive yet other benefits from them and milk to drink. Will they not, then, be grateful
But, nay, they have chosen gods other than Allah hoping that they might be helped
It is beyond their power to help them, and in effect such people end up guarding their false gods like committed hosts
So let not their utterances grieve you. Behold, We know what they conceal and what they declare
Does not man realize that We created him from male and female gametes? Yet, behold, he stands forth as an open contender of Truth! ('Nutfah' = Gamete, male or female)
And he makes comparisons for Us and forgets the fact of his creation, saying, "Who will revive these bones when they have crumbled to dust?" (
Say, "He will revive them Who brought them into being in the first instance. Yes, for He is the Knower of all acts of creation
(The same Creator) Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, so that, behold, you kindle from it
Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the like of them? Yes indeed - for He is the Creator, Knower of all acts of creation
When He intends a thing, His only Command to it is "Be" and it is
Glorified is He in Whose Hand rests the Mighty Dominion over all things, and unto Him you will be brought back. (And every step of yours heads to His Law of Requital (3)
Those vanguards who set up ranks (in order to defend the Divine System)
And those officers of the state who help maintain law and order
And those believers who convey the Reminder
(Are the living witnesses that) - Verily, most surely, your God is One
He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything that is between them (the intergalactic material) - And the Lord of the sunrises (and of the Light-giving Revelation)
Behold, We have beautified the lowest heaven nearest to the earth with ornaments, the stars and planets
And made them secure against every satanic force (The Revelation brings an end to the false claims of the fortune-telling astrologers)
Repelled faraway from the Truth, the 'occult sciences' despite their boisterous claims, can get not a hint of what Divine Revelation is
Outcast--and theirs is a lasting torment

Even if a thing of their conjecture comes to pass, they are pursued by a Flame of Brightness. (The Divine Revelation exposes the claimants to the 'occult sciences' (18:22), (26:210-212), (52:38), (67:)
And ask them to enlighten you, "What is more difficult and stronger - their creation or the rest of Our creation in the multiform Universe? Them (the humans) We have only created out of a sticky clay
Nay, but whereas you (O Prophet) marvel at the Universe, they mock - and again you marvel at their mocking
They take not to heart the wonders of Nature when reminded
And they turn to mockery every Wonder that they see
And of the Revelation they say, "This is nothing but magical eloquence
What! When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be raised again
And even our forefathers
Say, "Yes, indeed. And you will be brought low
There will be a single Rebuke, and then, behold, they will begin to see
And they will say, "Oh, woe unto us! This is the Day of Judgment
Yes - This is the Day of Decision you used to deny
Bring you up", it will be said, "The transgressors and their companions and the leaders whom they obeyed
Instead of Allah, and lead them onto the path to the Blazing Fire. ('Azwaj' in 37:22 = Companions)
Halt them! For, they must be questioned
What is the matter with you that you help not each other
Nay, but this Day they make full submission
And they will turn to one another asking, demanding
Some will say, "You used to approach us in power
The leaders will reply, "Nay, it were you yourself who were devoid of Faith
And we had no power at all over you. Nay, you were a people of unrestrained conduct
But now the Word of our Lord has come to pass about all of us. Verily, we are bound to taste the fruit of our deeds
So then, if we misled you, behold, we ourselves were astray
And on that Day, verily, they will be partners in a common doom. (14:21), (33:67), (3)
Behold, this is how We deal with the guilty
For when it was said to them, "There is no god but Allah", they showed arrogance
And used to say, "Shall we give up our gods for a mad poet
Nay, but he brought the Truth, and he confirmed the previous Messengers
Behold, you will indeed taste the grievous suffering
And you are requited only for what you have done
But the sincere servants of Allah
Theirs shall be a sustenance known to them
As the fruits of their labor, and they shall be honored
In the Gardens of Delight
Facing one another upon thrones of happiness
A cup from a gushing spring of Bliss brought around for them
Crystal clear, delicious to those who drink
No headache or hangover in it, nor will they get drunk
And in their company will be mates of modest gaze, endowed with vision
Faultless like the hidden ostrich eggs (of unblemished character)
And they will all turn to one another asking (socializing)
One of them speaks thus, "Behold, I had a close companion
He used to ask me, "What! Are you of those who affirm
That after we have died and become mere dust and bones, we will be called to account
A voice will be heard, "Will you people like to look at him
And then he looks and finds his companion in the midst of the blazing fire
He says to the companion in the fire, "By God! You had almost ruined me too
Had I not earned the blessing of my Lord, I would surely be of those given over to punishment
Are we then never to die (O My Companions of Paradise)
After our former death, and that we will never be among the suffering
Verily, this - this indeed, is the Supreme Triumph
For such an end should work all workers
Is this better as a welcome or the inedible cactus (the bitter tree of harming others (17:60), (44: 43)
Verily, We have appointed it a torment for the oppressors

For, behold, it is a tree that springs in the heart of the blazing Fire. (Harming others, oppression and violation of human rights build one's own Hellfire. Likewise, humans earn Paradise with their own hands (7:42), (16:32), (17:9), (29:55), (4)
Its growth like cobra heads. ('Shaitan' and 'Jaann' = Serpent, Cobra. (38:41-44), Harming others harms one's own 'Self
Verily, from it they must eat, and fill their bellies with it
And, behold, above all this they have a drink of burning despair
And once again, verily, the blazing Fire is their destination
For, verily, they had found their fathers on the wrong path
But they made haste to follow their footprints
This is how, indeed, most of the people of the old had gone astray before them
And verily, We had sent Warners among them
Behold, then, what happened to those who had been warned
Except for the sincere servants of Allah
And it was so when Noah cried to Us. Behold, how excellent are We as Responder
For, We saved him, his family and his followers from the great distress. ('Ahl' or the Household of a Prophet includes his followers)
And made his progeny and followers survive
And We left his remembrance for later generations
Peace and salutation to Noah in the Worlds
Verily, this is how We reward the benefactors of humanity
Behold, he was one of Our truly believing servants
And We caused the others to drown
And verily, to his group (of believers, later) belonged Abraham
When he came to his Lord with a noble heart
And thus spoke to his father and his people, "What is that you worship
It is a falsehood. Do you desire gods besides Allah
What do you think of the Lord of the Worlds
And he glanced at the stars
And said, "Behold, I am sick (of you worshiping false deities)
At that they turned their backs and went away from him
Then Abraham gently turned to their idols and said, "What! You do not eat
What ails you that you speak not
Then he turned upon them, striking them with the right hand (struck them hard)
The people came running to him
He said, "Do you worship that which you carve with your own hands
When Allah has created you and your handicraft
They said, "Build a structure for him and fling him into the blazing fire
But as they schemed against him, We brought them low
And he said, "Behold, I am going to my Lord Who will guide me (to refuge)
(Abraham emigrated to Syria and prayed), "My Lord! Grant me the company of the righteous, and children who will be righteous
So We gave him the good news of a clement son (Ishmael)

And when he was old enough to strive along with him, Abraham said, "O My dear son! I have a vision that I must give you to a life of test and tribulation for a Noble cause (37:107). So look, what do you think?" He said, "O My father! Do what you are commanded. God willing, you will find me of the steadfast." ('Zibh' & 'Zabh' = Sacrifice = Disregard comfort for a Noble cause. Just as 'Qatl' = Killing, fighting, humiliating, to bring low)

As both of them had surrendered themselves (to Allah), he made Ishmael prostrate on his forehead in gratitude. (Contrary to popular tradition Abraham never envisioned or intended to slaughter his son)
We called unto him, "O Abraham
You have already affirmed the vision. We - This is so - We must reward the doers of good
This was indeed a Trial, clear in itself. (Leaving the prestigious office of Chief Priesthood in Babylon and now the comfort of Syria for the wilderness of Makkah)

We exchanged his life for a Momentous Sacrifice. (Please notice here the absence of the Biblical and the traditional myth of a 'ram' sent from the heavens. Also, note that slaughtering of a sheep or goat, by no means, can be considered a Momentous Sacrifice. (14)
And We left for him remembrance among the later generations
Peace and salutation to Abraham
Thus do We reward the benefactors of humanity
He was one of Our truly believing servants
Then We gave him the good news of Isaac - a Prophet, among men of quality
And We gave lasting felicity to him and Isaac. But among their generations are the doers of good, and those who, by doing wrong to others, clearly wrong their own "Self
Yes indeed, We bestowed excellence upon Moses and Aaron
And We saved them and their people from the awesome distress (of bondage)
And helped them so that they became the victors

And We gave both of them the Scripture that helped to distinguish the right from wrong. ('Kitabal Mustabeen' = the Book that helped to distinguish = The Torah. 'Kitabil Mubin' = The Book that distinguishes = The Qur'an)
And showed both of them the Straight Path
And We left for them remembrance among the later generations
Peace and salutation to Moses and Aaron
Verily! This is how We reward the benefactors of humanity
Indeed, both of them were Our truly believing servants
And, behold, Elias (Elijah) was one of Our Messengers
When he said to his people, "Will you not walk aright
You call upon Ba'l, and disregard the Best of creators
Allah! Your Lord, and Lord of your forefathers
But they denied him. And they will certainly be called to account
But the sincere servants of Allah
And we left for him remembrance among the later generations
Peace and salutation to Elias
Verily, this is how we reward the benefactors of humanity
Indeed, He was among our truly believing servants
And, behold, Lot was indeed among the Messengers
When We saved him and his household, everyone
Except an old woman who was among those who stayed behind in belief
And then We destroyed the rest
And verily, you pass by their sites by day
And by night. Will you not, then, use your sense to draw lessons
And, behold, Jonah was indeed among the Messengers
When he fled like a runaway slave onto a laden ship. ('Abaqa' = Fled like a runaway slave. He migrated before Allah's Command)
He had cast an arrow and missed the mark. (Untimely action)
Then the Fish grabbed him while he was blaming himself. (Again, usually a whale is mentioned here. But the whale is a mammal and not a fish, and the Qur'an which is never inaccurate, speaks of)
And had he not been a valiant swimmer
(The fish would have eaten him up and) he would have remained in her belly disintegrated there and further until the Day of Rising
(He freed himself and swam to safety.) Then We cast him on the shore, while he was exhausted
We caused him to rest under a well-grown fruitful tree
And We sent him back to his people, a hundred thousand, even more
And this time they believed in him and so We let them enjoy this life

Now (O Prophet) ask them if your Lord has daughters whereas they have sons! (Do they wish to live with superstitions, such as that Jonah lived in the belly of a fish for forty days and then he got free only by reciting a verse, or that your Lord has offspring)
Or is it that We have created angels female and they witnessed it
Attention! It is out of their own invention that they say
That Allah has begotten." And, verily, they tell a lie too
When they say, "He has chosen daughters over sons
What is amiss with you? How do you judge
Will you not then reflect
Or have you a clear authoritative evidence
Then bring your Divine Authority if you are truthful
And they imagine relationship between the unseen forces and their Lord. But the unseen forces know their assignments and constantly remain in His servitude
Glorified is Allah from what they attribute to Him
But the sincere servants of Allah
Verily, neither you nor what you worship
Can tempt the sincere servants against Him
Only the one who rushes to the Blazing Fire
The sincere servants say, "Each one of us has an assignment
And, behold, we are soldiers in ranks
And, verily, we, yes we are they who strive to establish His Glory on earth. ('Sabh' = Swim with long and strong laps and strides. It is not the rolling of the rosary-beads or to hymn some words)
And indeed the disbelievers used to say
If only we had a reminder from the old generations, or a Scripture as they had
We would certainly be sincere servants of Allah alone
And yet, now they are denying the Truth. In time, they will come to know what they denied
Our Word has already gone forth to Our servants, the Messengers
That verily, they - indeed they - would be helped
And that Our soldiers - they indeed - would be the victors
So (O Prophet) withdraw from the disbelievers for a while
And see them for what they do, and soon they will see what they now don't
Do they really wish to hasten Our retribution
But when it comes upon their front-yards, it will be a dreadful awakening for those who have been sufficiently warned
Hence, turn aside from them for a while
And see them for what they do, and soon they will see what they now don't
Glory to your Lord, the Lord of Majesty, Exalted above their contriving
And Peace and salutation to all the Message-bearers
And all Praise is due to Allah, the Sustainer of the Worlds! (And to that end strive the Soldiers in Ranks)
SAAD. As-Sadiq - Full of Truth, this Qur'an is a Profound Reminder. Embracing all that is worth taking to your hearts, it can give you eminence

But nay, the deniers are lost in false pride and opposition for the sake of opposition. Hence, they split their own personalities forcing themselves into maintaining double standards in life. ('Shiqaq' = Opposition, schism, splitting, split-personality. Double standards; since denial of a reality does not make it disappear)
How many a generation have We (Our Law of Requital) wiped out before them, and they cried out when it was too late to escape
Now these people wonder that a Warner has come to them from their own midst! And the disbelievers say, "This is a wizard, a liar
Does he blend all the gods into One God? Behold, this is a thing mind-boggling
Their leaders go about saying, "Walk away and hold on to your gods! This, behold, is the only thing to do. And this (mind-boggling thing) seems to be designed with ulterior motives
We have never heard of this in the latest religion. This (concept of One God) is nothing but a made-up tale! (Even the Christians subscribe to a Triune God)
What! Has the Reminder come down only to him among us?" Nay, in fact, it is My Own Reminder that they distrust (and not you O Prophet). Nay, they have not yet tasted My Requital
Or with them are the treasures of your Lord's Grace? - The Almighty, the Grantor of Gifts
Or is it that theirs is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them? If so, let them ascend to Supremacy by all means
But here it is! Defeated confederates are these, however closely they might band together
And before them denied the Truth, the people of Noah, Aad and Pharaoh of the firm stakes. ('Zil-awtad' could indicate 'the lord of the Pyramids)
And Thamud, and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the Wood-dales (of Midyan). And they were clans strongly banded
All of them accused the Messengers of lying. Hence, My Law justly grasped them
Now these people only wait a single Blast from which they recover not
And they mock, "Our Lord! Bring for us our sentence before the Day of Account
Bear with patience whatever they may say, and remember Our servant David, the man of strength and resources. He always turned unto Us
Behold, We subdued for him the strong Mountain Tribes that strove along with him night and day
And the nomad riders of the Ta'er Tribe were all obedient to him. (21:79), (2)
We strengthened his Kingdom and gave him wisdom and good judgment. And We endowed him with the ability to make just decisions, and speak eloquently. (1)
Have you heard of the story of the two disputing men when they climbed the wall into his private chamber

When they breached his privacy, he was startled. They said, "Be not startled!" We both are disputing with each other as to who has done wrong to the other. Therefore, judge fairly between us, deviate not from equity and guide us to the even path

One of them said, "Behold, this my brother has ninety nine farms, whereas I have only one. And yet he says, 'Give it over to me', and he dominates me in eloquence." ('Na'jah' = Ewe = Female sheep or deer = Agricultural farm)

David said, "He has certainly wronged you in demanding your farm in addition to his farms. Thus, behold, many close associates and business-partners treat each other unfairly - except those who believe in the Divine Values and care for the needs of others - but how few are they!" Afterwards, David wondered that We had tried him. (The feudal and economic system in his kingdom needed reform, as the poor were getting poorer). He implored his Lord to absolve his imperfections, and he immediately bowed himself and turned unto Him for guidance
So We absolved his imperfections, and, behold - He remained ever close to Our Laws and his efforts reached a happy destination

(We said to him), "O David! We have made you a ruler in the earth, therefore, establish the System of justice and equity for people. Never let your judgment be swayed by personal whims causing you to deviate from the Path of Allah. For those who wander from the Path of Allah, is a strict retribution for having forgotten the Day of Account

(No action goes uncompensated since) We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in vain - without meaning and purpose. Such is the assumption of those who disbelieve. (10:4), (11:7), (45:22), (53:31). Woe from the Fire to those who deny the Truth
Shall We treat those who believe and augment the society as We treat those who spread corruption in the land? Or shall We treat the guardians of the Law as the Law-breakers
This is a Scripture that We have revealed unto you (O Prophet), full of lasting Bliss that they may ponder its Messages and that people of understanding may take them to heart
And unto David We granted Solomon, how excellent a servant! Behold, in every situation He would turn to Divine Laws
In the evenings he used to examine his cavalry of nobly-bred, swift-footed horses
He would say, "Verily, I love my fondness of all that is good because it reminds me of my Lord", as the horses raced away until hidden by the veil of distance
Bring them back unto me!" - and would lovingly stroke their legs and their necks

(That was Solomon and) We indeed tried him, and set upon his throne a mere body, and thereupon he turned to Us. (His son, the crown prince Rehoboam was just a hopeless presence (34:14). Until that point in history, the Kingdom of Israel was inherited among the generations of Prophet Jacob

Solomon prayed, "O My Lord! Absolve my imperfections and bestow upon me the gift of a kingdom that may not suit anyone after me. Verily, You are the Giver of Gifts." (He did not wish to leave his great kingdom in incompetent hands and in all probability was thinking of merit in preference over lineage)
So We gave him the science of making the wind serve him and it carried his ships wherever he intended
And made subservient to him the wild unruly men - every kind of builder and diver. (2)
And others linked together in chains of discipline
We told him, "All this is Our Gift for you. Give freely or withhold, in matters of the State, according to your best judgment. It is given to you beyond count
And, behold - He remained ever close to Our Laws and his efforts always reached a happy destination

And remember Our servant Job, when he called upon his Lord, "Behold, the serpent has bitten me and I am in distress and suffering." ('Satan has touched me', as a metonym = Serpent has bitten me. He was left alone from his caravan and family, ran out of the essential supplies, and now this happened (4:163), (6:8)
(We told him), "Strike the ground with your foot (move a little bit). And here is cool water to wash with and a refreshing drink
And We gave him back his family and followers and, in time, doubled their numbers as a Grace from Us. And herein is a reminder for people of understanding (on the virtue of patience)

(And finally We told him,) "Now gather your strength and travel the land and break not your pledge." Behold, We found him steadfast. How excellent a servant! In every situation he turned to Our Commands
And also remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of strength and vision
Verily, We endowed them with sincerity of purpose and with exceptional foresight. Hence, in all their efforts they never lost sight of the desired destination
Behold, according to Our Standards, they were of the elect, excellent, fulfilling the mental, moral and physical needs of humanity
Also mention Ishmael
Let this be a Reminder - for, verily, there is a most beautiful destination for those who journey through life honorably
Gardens of Eden, the perpetual Bliss, with gates wide-open for them
Relaxing therein, they will be hosted with all kinds of food and drink
And with them are well-matched companions of modest gaze
This is what you are promised for the Day of Account
This, verily, is Our Giving with no end to it
Yes, this is so. But, for those who kept trespassing the Moral Values, is a destination with no good in it
Hell that is! Wherein they burn - the worst bed to lie on
This, then, - so let them taste it - the drink of burning distress and ice-cold wind. (Distress they caused others and insensitivity they showed toward oppression and injustice)
And other penalties in pairs (heat-cold, glare-darkness, noise-isolation, anxiety-depression, desire-hopelessness, etc)
It will be said to the ringleaders, "Here is your group going with you headlong. There is no welcome for them, for only the Fire is here to embrace them
The followers will say to the leaders, "Nay, but you! There is no welcome for you either! It is you who sent this forth for us! What a station of plight!" (14:21), (33:67), (34:32), (3)
Then the followers will say, "Our Lord! Whoever has sent this forth for us, oh, double for him the suffering in Fire
Then they will exclaim to one another, "What is amiss with us? We do not see people whom we counted among evil
Whom we used to ridicule. (Are they not here) or is it that our eyes are missing them
Such, behold, will in truth be the argumentation of people of the Fire
Say, "I am only a Warner, and there is no god but Allah, the One, the Irresistible
Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them - Exalted in Might, Ever-Forgiving
Say, "That is a Tremendous News
From which you turn away
Say! "I had no knowledge of the top leaders of the past, and of their disputations
It is revealed unto me only that I am a plain Warner." (To give warning plainly and publicly)
(The disputations began ever since mankind came into being.) When your Lord said to the angels, "Behold, I am about to create a human being out of clay. (Angels = Laws in the Universe)
And when I have designed him, and breathed into him from My Energy (from the Attribute of Free Will) then be submissive to him
Thereupon the angels agreed to be submissive before him, all of them together. ('Sajdah' = Literally, prostration, is due to Allah alone, hence, the allegorical meaning here)
Except Iblis - he acted arrogantly and denied the Command. (Iblis = Satan = selfish desire of the humans)
Said He, "O Iblis! What has kept you from being submissive to that which I have created with My Hands? Are you too proud or are you of the rebellious
Iblis replied, "I am better than he. You created me of fire while you created him of clay." (Emotions are fiery in relation to the cool 'clay' of higher controls)
Said He, "Go forth from here, for, behold, you are condemned
And My rejection is on you until the Day of Judgment
Iblis said, "Then, My Lord! Give me respite till the Day when they are raised
Answered He, "Verily so, you shall be among those who are given respite
Until the Day of Appointed Time
Iblis said, "I swear by Your Honor, I will certainly lead them all astray
But such of them as are Your sincere servants
Said He, "The Truth is this - and this Truth do I state
That certainly I will fill Hell with you and with such of them as follow you, together
(O Messenger) say to them, "I ask of you no reward for this Message, nor am I a pretender
This (Qur'an), behold, is no less than a Reminder to the Worlds
And you will most certainly know the Truth of it all after a lapse of time
The Revelation of this Book issues from Allah, the Almighty, the Wise
Behold, it is We Who have revealed this Book to you (O Prophet) setting forth the Truth. Therefore, serve Allah sincere in your Faith in Him alone

Know and make it known that the Pristine Religion is for Allah and from Him alone.
